title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 r. 202.70.15 - Adjournments of Conferences
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 r. 202.70.15 - Adjournments of Conferences

State Regulations

By leave of court as provided by Rule 1(d), attorneys are
encouraged to use remote appearance technology in order to avoid adjournments
of conferences. Adjournments on consent are permitted with the approval of the
court for good cause where notice of the request is given to all parties. Adjournment of a conference will not change any subsequent date in the
preliminary conference order, unless otherwise directed by the court. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22
r. 202.70.15. Amended
eff. 7/12/2022. Amended

New

York State Register August 3, 2022/Volume XLIV, Issue 31, eff. 8/3/2022

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
